page.title: 04 Wellow and old residents.
page.content: Wellow is a small community spread over a wide area with no real centre.Most of the older residents have retired from old family businesses like Mr.Dawkins, who was born into a family of wheelwrights, whose shop was beside a hardware store, where wheels for farm carts,forest trucks and carriages were built.The life style of the older residents has become much better than before because there is electricity, running water and sewage pipes.The old established residents support the growth of the community,but they find that the village life does not suit the younger people.They seem to think that the bond between the villagers has become very thin with the arrival of newcomers. By Samantha Ashford,Tracey Forder Kirsty Lamb,Rebecca Pearson.
